10:59 <CIA-122> Eduard Moraru xwiki-manager-4.2-milestone-3 \* r8898f2c https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-manager/commit/8898f2cc1134ca8e4c4cb874eb2e7d6bf41c2942 / pom.xml : [release] Preparing release xwiki-manager-4.2-milestone-3 - http://git.io/XeEVWg

11:26 <CIA-122> Marius Dumitru Florea feature-portlet-3.5.x \* r2a88b80 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/2a88b80c8a77c4d0114f5ab8a9a083d40dd196bf / (2 files in 2 dirs): Overwrite part of the skin in portlet mode. - http://git.io/v7gdTg  
11:26 <CIA-122> Marius Dumitru Florea feature-portlet-3.5.x \* r6628eb7 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/6628eb74eb5be1faf801d24ce043b7fa0a88bd70 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/resources/js/xwiki/widgets/jumpToPage.js : Make the 'Jump to page' feature work partially. - http://git.io/9soIpA  
11:43 <tekzilla> has quit  
11:54 <+jvdrean> ludo spotted an issue with the import and the activity stream, it's not related to hidden document as we first thought  
11:55 <+jvdrean> on master, if you import a XAR and you look at the activity stream, there will be only one event there  
11:57 <eshan> has left #xwiki  
12:02 <vmassol> jvdrean: could you report a jira and mark it blocker for RC1? + add the issue in the RN for 4.2M3?  
12:02 <vmassol> jvdrean: it's not changing data in the DB right? it's just a display issue?  
12:03 <+jvdrean> vmassol: for the moment I don't know, and we have 2 distinct issues  
12:04 <+jvdrean> - one with events grouped by requestId (the import problem), when I look at the history it seems the group by has been here for a long time  
12:04 <+jvdrean> (but they were not grouped in 3.x for some reason)  
12:04 <+jvdrean> - one with hidden events preventing older not hidden events to be displayed (I'm on it too)  
12:04 <+jvdrean> I'll create JIRAs  
12:05 <vmassol> if the issues are just display issues they can be fixed in RC1  
12:06 <vmassol> if they are modifying the AS data in the DB then we need to stop the M3 release and fix now IMO  
12:06 <vmassol> from what you say it seems it's jus a display issue  
12:06 <vmassol> right?  
12:06 <vmassol> (jvdrean)  
12:06 <vmassol> what I mean is that we shouldn't loose existing AS data  
12:06 <vmassol> in the dB  
12:07 <+jvdrean> I think they're both query issues  
12:07 <+jvdrean> but the data in the AS is fine (vmassol)  
12:08 <vmassol> ok so IMO notes in the RN of 4.2M3 + blockers for RC1 should be good enough  
12:11 <+Enygma`> I am done with the build for the 4.2M3 release  
12:11 <+Enygma`> so you guys should be able to start committing on master now  
12:12 <+Enygma`> I will proceed with making the announcements and the rest of the formalities  
12:12 <vmassol> thanks Enygma`  
12:12 <+Enygma`> sorry I did not finish yesterday evening, but the build broke at one point so it had to be restarted  
12:16 <CIA-122> Marius Dumitru Florea feature-portlet-3.5.x \* r6f436a6 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/6f436a6b9282ffe9d8e9c0306c6c668cf5243281 / (3 files in 3 dirs): Portlet API is not included in the war built by the packager plugin when scope is provided. - http://git.io/Sngctg  
12:19 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
12:54 <+Enygma`> vmassol: Question about the CLIRR report  
12:55 <+Enygma`> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/ReleasePlanHelp#HGenerateCLIRRReport says that I should remove the excludes, generate the report and the revert the changes so that the exclusions are kept...  
12:55 <vmassol> yes  
12:56 <+Enygma`> but since most of the exclusions specify: Remove the following excludes after we release the current version as final  
12:56 <vmassol> yep  
12:56 <vmassol> the key is "final"  
12:56 <+Enygma`> and I am releasing a milestone, that looks more like indications for the CLIRR report of a final release  
12:56 <vmassol> Enygma`: if you remove them now  
12:56 <vmassol> master is still going to fail  
12:56 <vmassol> it's comparing against 4.1.4  
12:56 <+Enygma`> how do I do the CLIRR report for a milestone release, that is supposed to list differences from the previous milestone release to the current one?  
12:57 <vmassol> it's not  
12:57 <vmassol> it's supposed to list all backward incompat since 4.1.4  
12:57 <vmassol> so same result as for 4.2M2 + the new incompats if any  
12:58 <+Enygma`> so in each milestone release notes we duplicate the previous milestone release notes, plus some new ones in the meanwhile, always comparing to the most recent stable release (4.1.4) ?  
12:58 <vmassol> yes  
12:58 <+Enygma`> weird, because we don`t do that for the features... but anyway  
12:58 <vmassol> the reason is:  
12:59 <vmassol> 1) it's simpler for the user  
12:59 <vmassol> he doesn't have to read all past RNs  
12:59 <vmassol> 2) it's the same amount of work for us  
12:59 <vmassol> another option  
13:00 <vmassol> would be not to list CLIRR erports in Milestones release and only in final but  I feel it would give less warning to devs who use the xwik platform  
13:00 <vmassol> anyway if you think it's better to list only diff you could propose it; right now I feel it's a bit more work and a bit less friendly for the user  
13:01 <vmassol> what's important though is that the RN says that it's since 4.1.4  
13:01 <+Enygma`> I see  
13:01 <+Enygma`> and when we release the final, we remove the exceptions and update the compared version  
13:01 <vmassol> yes  
13:01 <+Enygma`> ok, cool... I`ll update the instructions with some clarifications on that  
13:02 <+Enygma`> thanks  
13:02 <vmassol> np  
13:24 <cjd> has quit  
13:33 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:41 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
13:42 <evalica> has quit  
13:42 <evalica1> is now known as <evalica>  
13:54 <sburjan> has quit  
13:55 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
14:00 <vmassol> git question: imagine that I'm on a branch and I've just a commit there but I want this commit to be on master instead. Can I push on master from the branch? As in: git push origin master?  
14:01 <vmassol> or do I need to remove the local commit, stash the change, switch to master, commit, push and switch again to the branch?  
14:08 <+jvdrean> vmassol: couldn't you switch to master, cherry-pick from the local branch and push  
14:08 <vmassol> jvdrean: I've not pushed  
14:08 <+jvdrean> I know  
14:08 <vmassol> I can cherry pick locally?  
14:08 <+jvdrean> I don't see why not  
14:09 <vmassol> never tried  
14:09 <vmassol> that still requires switching  
14:09 <vmassol> I was wondering if there was a shortcut  
14:09 <vmassol> (switching means stashing changes)  
14:09 <+jvdrean> indeed you'll need to stash uncommited changes  
14:15 <CIA-122> Vincent Massol master \* rba4cace https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/ba4cace1d7e065a90effe28f24e1262f2707927f / (2 files in 2 dirs): [Misc] Remove unneeded dependency on oldcore in WikiComponentInvocationHandler + added missing deps in pom.xml - http://git.io/junKvA  
14:23 <+Enygma`> why do you need to stash if you say you have already committed to the local branch?  
14:24 <+Enygma`> as JV said, just cherry-pick (no -x since the local branch will go away)  
14:24 <vmassol> Enygma`: for other changes  
14:24 <vmassol> cherry pick seems the simplest  
14:24 <vmassol> this is what I've done in the end

15:39 <vmassol> ah ok thanks sdumitriu, that's a nice shortcut  
15:39 <vmassol> will try it next time  
15:39 <sdumitriu> I think it works with HEAD instead of branchname, but I didn't try it  
15:40 <sdumitriu> HEAD works in any branch, while you have to specify the current branch name  
15:40 <vmassol> ok  
15:41 <sdumitriu> But indeed, cherry-pick works with any commit ID, even commits that are no longer accessible from a branch  
15:41 <sdumitriu> That's a good way of recovering commits that you've accidentally lost  
15:42 <sdumitriu> (combined with git reflog)  
15:46 <vmassol> @sergiu: I wanted to push only 1 commit though  
15:46 <vmassol> (@sdumitriu)  
15:46 <vmassol> so push from a branch is going to push everything that is not on master from the branch no?  
15:47 <vmassol> (push from a branch to master I mean)  
15:52 <sdumitriu> vmassol: Yes  
15:53 <sdumitriu> You only push branches, you can't push commits  
15:53 <vmassol> ok so cherry pick is the only good answer to my question  
15:53 <sdumitriu> I mean you do push a commit, but the commit has its parent(s) commit hard-coded in it  
15:53 <sdumitriu> So you have to push all the ancestors up to an existing commit on the remote repo  
15:53 <vmassol> I see  
16:41 <CIA-122> Eduard Moraru master \* r016bb0b https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/016bb0b56c2c28e79e421e2908b33024123c5e86 / xwiki-commons-core/pom.xml : [clirr] removed leftover exclusion. It is now integrated in 4.1.4 - http://git.io/oM4xTw  
16:53 <Enygma`> vmassol: I have an issue with the clirr report  
16:54 <Enygma`> in 4.2M2, there are 2 issues on rendering  
16:54 <Enygma`> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise42M2#HAPIBreakages  
16:55 <Enygma`> however, in 4.2M3 (the current release), I no longer have those 2 issues  
16:55 <silviar> has quit  
16:55 <vmassol> do you know why?  
16:55 <Enygma`> the only difference is that 4.2M2 was compared to 4.1.3 and my current one is compared to 4.1.4  
16:55 <vmassol> so 4.1.4 introduced a breakage? which would be bad  
16:55 <Enygma`> however, those 2 rendering issues do not appear in the release notes of 4.1.4 http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise414#HAPIBreakages  
16:56 <vmassol> (for a bug fix release)  
16:56 <vmassol> do they appear in the commits?  
16:56 <silviar> has joined #xwiki  
16:56 <Enygma`> wdym?  
16:57 <vmassol> I just checked PropertyDescriptor  
16:57 <vmassol> I can see the change is from XCOMMONS-212  
16:57 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-212#  
16:57 <vmassol> which only has commits on master: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-212?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin:bitbucket-commits-tabpanel  
16:57 <Enygma`> not PropertyDescriptor  
16:58 <vmassol> ah my bad  
16:58 <vmassol> that's not rendering  
16:58 <vmassol> taking WikiMacroFactory now  
16:58 <Enygma`> you are right  
16:58 <vmassol> XWIKI-7880  
16:59 <Enygma`> I have them  
16:59 <Enygma`> I was expecting them to be under xwiki-rendering  
16:59 <Enygma`> but they are under xwiki-platform  
16:59 <Enygma`> so it's OK  
16:59 <vmassol> ok  
16:59 <Enygma`> sorry for the noise  
16:59 <vmassol> np  
16:59 <vmassol> good to check!  
17:34 <Enygma`> vmassol: can I please get access on OW2?  
17:34 <Enygma`> user: enygma  
17:34 <vmassol> hmm can I give you that?  
17:34 <vmassol> checking  
17:34 <Enygma`> I have no idea :)  
17:34 <Enygma`> just created a user  
17:35 <vmassol> yes I can :)  
17:35 <vmassol> one day you should use a real user name....  
17:35 <vmassol> and stop hiding behind a pseudo :)  
17:35 <vmassol> I've made you admin  
17:36 <Enygma`> it`s the Internets... :)  
17:36 <Enygma`> thanks  
17:39 <Enygma`> hm... something`s wrong  
17:39 <Enygma`> Could not chdir to home directory /var/lib/gforge/chroot/home/users/enygma: No such file or directory  
17:39 <Enygma`> This is a restricted account.  
17:39 <Enygma`> You cannot execute anything here.  
17:39 <Enygma`> Goodbye.  
17:39 <Enygma`> Connection to forge.objectweb.org closed.  
17:40 <vmassol> checking  
17:40 <Enygma`> I get this while trying to ssh on my own ow2 account  
17:40 <Enygma`> I tried it because the publish\_ow2 scp failed with the same "Could not chdir to home directory" message  
17:40 <vmassol> can you try again?  
17:40 <Enygma`> k  
17:40 <vmassol> I've changed some permissions  
17:41 <vmassol> I checked all boxes now  
17:41 <Enygma`> same  
17:41 <vmassol> hmm I don't know  
17:41 <Enygma`> ssh [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
17:42 <Enygma`> this is what I`ve used (since that is what the push\_ow2 script seems to try to use)  
17:42 <Enygma`> do I need to do something to my account to activate it further?  
17:42 <vmassol> I have no idea  
17:42 <Enygma`> ah  
17:42 <Enygma`> wait  
17:43 <Enygma`> I think I have to register a key  
17:43 <vmassol> yes makes sense  
17:43 <vmassol> :)  
17:43 <Enygma`> though it seems that it is just to avoid typing the password at login...  
17:43 <Enygma`> trying anyway  
17:46 <Enygma`> "This is done by a cron job, so it may not happen immediately.  Please allow for a one hour delay." ... sheesh  
17:47 <Enygma`> and I don`t even know if that is what I need to do  
17:48 <Enygma`> actually... I don`t think this is it, because in the release, I am connecting from maven.xwiki.org, not my personal computer  
17:48 <Enygma`> and we don`t upload ssh keys to maven.xwiki.org  
17:49 <vmassol> there are ssh keys on maven.xwiki.org  
17:49 <vmassol> now I don't see the realtionship with ow2

18:35 <CIA-122> Jean-Vincent Drean master \* r82b52f6 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/82b52f6cfcbb7374017cab06b2d2c596c34a0dad / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-panels/xwiki-platform-panels-ui/src/main/resources/Panels/Applications.xml : XWIKI-8199 : In the applications panel the "more applications" button doesn't behave correctly when clicked multiple times in a row - http://git.io/U1zuLg  
18:41 <silviar> has quit  
18:45 <+jvdrean> vmassol: there was 2 issues with the AS  
18:45 <+jvdrean> XWIKI-7884  
18:45 <+jvdrean> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7884  
18:45 <+jvdrean> which I fixed  
18:45 <vmassol> jvdrean: ok, I'll check your fixes later. do you know if they were regressions?  
18:45 <vmassol> we need to flag them as regression in jira if they were  
18:46 <vmassol> (and ideally link to the jira issue that introduced them)
